ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned SO MUCH about myself and about the writing process from this course! My trust in my own voice developed so much during this semester, as did my understanding of what factors build a strong play.

I learned how to tap into emotions and stories that I had long buried. I gained a less structuralist view on playwriting and started expanding my body of work outside of my comfort zone of writing comedy.

I developed the practice of writing automatically which allows me to tap into my unconscious desires of my own playwrights voice and of my characters. I learned how much playwriting is not a linear process and the benefit of writing in a group of writers. How playwriting is truly an art to be heard not only read. I learned also to trust my characters and to not over calculate an ending.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are truly no weaknesses to this course. I felt engaged, supported, challenged, and warmly accepted into the creative environment.

This course was a really excellent production seminar that I loved attending every Monday and Wednesday. Its both a strength and a weakness that it is a production seminar, because while Deb provides excellent guidance, she ultimately is not giving you weekly assignments of write exactly this and you need to be able to hold yourself accountable in order to finish your final play. However, its totally worth it, and if you have the emotional energy to invest in writing a play during the semester you take this course, you will feel so incredibly rewarded upon your drafts completion.

Strength: Debs various fill in the blank prompts, and around the circle questions prompt meaningful reflections on the human condition.

Weakness: I wish the consumption and discussion of plays played a larger role in the class, especially toward the start of the semester. I feel like I didnt get enough on the consumption end before I needed to produce my own play.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would STRONGLY recommend this course to another student if you are a human being who cares deeply about stories! Truly, the only requirement is a willingness to be honest with yourself and to work hard, and if these promises are kept, you will be abundantly rewarded.

Yes, 100%. If youre even the slightest bit interested in playwriting, this course is for you. Fair warning that it does take a lot of self-motivation, as there arent a lot of hard deadlines other than the midterm and final, so if you struggle with that, make sure you find a way to hold yourself accountable.

100%. If you have any interest in playwriting, but dont prioritize it, Debs class will make you want to! Her practices, even if you resist them, will render the writing a part of your life and you will leave the class with a rough draft of a play. What more could you want!
Absolutely! Deb is a fantastic professor with a gift for facilitating trusting and productive writing communities.
